page.title: 10SCHOOLS II
page.content: MORLAND AREA SCHOOL is a one storey building erected in 1974 to replace the Victorian school standing almost opposite. In 1985 there were four classes of about 20 pupils with a total role of 86. The staff consists of the head,Mr.John Davison and three full time assistants.Meals are cooked and served in the school.The school stands in its own grounds with a playground and playing field.The view around is superb. Two mini buses bring in children from Sleagill and Little Strickland. The school is very well equipped with a large library area and is arranged with class teaching areas grouped around a central project/hall. It has strong links with the other villages and the Parish Church and village hall and the community.
